name: supposably
content:
supposably adverb
(POSSIBLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to say you have read or been told something although you are not certain it is true, or do not believe it is true: Their special green milkshakes cost supposably £50 a shake. Supposably there's a ghost in the the pond, but she has never seen it. Synonyms
apparently
supposedly
More examplesFewer examplesSupposably, they offer the best beef sandwich in town.The drinks list has a lot of sangria (white or red, supposably quite good) and wines on it.It is up to women what they want to wear, especially in a society that is supposably free and tolerant of others.Why do you think that so often it is kids who supposably see ghosts?

supposably adverb
(LIKELY)
formal used to say what you think is the likely situation : The structure is over 50 years old, and supposably it cannot be moved. The hallucinations he is suffering are supposably due to the drug he is taking. Synonym
presumably
